intro: Stigmaphyllon ledifolium, commonly known as the velvetleaf stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
